Message.Title: Dec 21, 2012 prophesy
Message.Msg: Deal or no deal on the Fiscal Cliff, taxes are going higher, and the level of U.S. Government spending is going to dwindle because the stimulus package is tapped out, current levels of spending on defense, entitlements and other areas are also not sustainable and are poised for budget cuts. We will soon see the economic support that the Bush tax cuts provided as they evaporate and are replaced with higher tax rates and budget cuts. To get a sampling of what the combined impact of higher taxes and reduced government spending might feel like in 2013, all we have to do is take a look at Europe. Italy, Spain, Portugal and Greece have all raised taxes and cut government spending in the past couple of years, and the resulting effects have been quite devastating. It did not take long for unemployment to spike and economic weakness to set in as consumers and businesses also cut spending. There will be riots in the street of America. Glen Beck was right. It took less than 4 years.

Message.Title: Faux Noise Guest spells out exactly why the Prez won
Message.Msg: Fox News Guest: Obama Won by Lying About 'Rape Camps' Under Romney Posted: 10 Nov 2012 06:00 AM PST At least one conservative Fox News commentator isn't blaming Mitt Romney's loss on Hurricane Sandy. On Thursday, tea party-backed radio host Michael Graham told Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly that President Barack Obama scared voters by claiming that women would be "forced into rape camps" under the Republican presidential nominee. Graham explained that Obama was not elected with a mandate because "he didn't run on an affirmative campaign." "He ran on the Republicans are Satan incarnate and if women vote for them, they're going to be forced into rape camps," the radio host insisted. "And when that's your campaign, you can't be surprised when the people you ran against don't want to work with you and you don't have an issue to rally people around."

Topic.Title: VETRANS DAY

Message.Msg: I joined the Air Force during the iranian crisis, if we had other then Carter we may of went to war... I worked full time 40 hours for the Military Job, in the save building I worked another full time job as a contractor, then part time on the weekends. Free time was for sleeping and classes on the job. When I could take a class I was usually surrounded by colored foreigners going to school for free, eating for free and living for free...!!! Sure GLAD I didn't have to DIE for them !!! Sure SAD for those who did die for MUDS, while their own children get JACK cause of being NON BROWN/BLACK, (by the way my parents were foreigners, legal ones, and never got those freebies ) Who's the RACIST !!!???

Topic.Title: Forbes Thought Of The Day - September 24, 2012

Message.Msg: //... It's pretty easy to identify parasites, those who live at the expense of others...// And AGAIN you put your finger on it (not for the first time, I'm sure, eh WalWal?...): you're again referring rather clearly to middle managers and above. These same who have sought at every turn to undercut wages, to roll back workplace safety requirements, to Welsh on pension, healthcare and other obligations, and in a hundred other ways to seek to "put workers in their proper place" (wage slaves will have to do, alas, as actual slaves have come to be frowned upon by the wild-eyed radical liberal/progressive/leftist crowd), to socialize/"externalize" costs and losses of every kind, transferring them to the public at large (or to their own employees in particular), to pay hordes of K Street lobbyists to draft sui generis special protections and advantages and benefits into "model" legislation for the rubber stamp of a boughtandpaidfor Congress (RepubliCONs, mostly, but -- no denying it -- also a significant percentage of DemoCON DINOs). These same whose Mephistophelean anti-Pareto machinations and glibfibs (think the Grinch's quickfooted recovery in response to Cindy Lou Who's earnest question) have led with staggering success (the Southern voter being what he/she is... see an earlier post) to ALL the fruits (AND THEN SOME, by about an other 14% in real wages adjusted for inflation) of improved worker efficiency and productivity during the past 30+ years flowing up to the top 1% (and a handful of their choice lackeys/mouthpieces/apologists). "Work harder, work smarter, EARN LESS!!!" just wouldn't have had the desired effect... On September 24, 2012, I was astonished to find displayed on an unsolicited interstitial popup screen the following Forbes Thought of the Day: “When a man tells you he got rich through hard work, ask him: Whose?” - Don Marquis. Too TOO true, that... Which is why I'm sure there were at least a couple of layoffs in the Forbes editorial department later that day.
